O2Jam Event Package¶

This is the part where OJN stores BPM, Notes, Measure Changes and AutoPlays.

For each level (easy, normal, hard), the number of packages are specified. So we know how many packages we need to loop through

For each package header, it defines the number of events that will occur after it.

By knowing the amount of events and the location of the note, we can find out the offset

Consider this:

        P E P E E E E P E E P E P E E E E E E E E
Events  1   4         2     1   8
Snap      1   1 2 3 4   1 2   1   1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8
Measure 0   1         1     2   2
Note      ^       ^       ^   ^               ^

From this, we can tell the offset of the notes by calculating the offset from a BPM List and taking a fraction of the beat by looking at the snap.

Notice that some snaps have no data in them, these are useful to “pad” these notes into place if they have a complex snap.

There are more specifications on other data decryption in open2jam.

class reamber.o2jam.O2JEventPackage.O2JEventMeasureChange(fracLength: float = 1.0)¶

If the value is 0.75, the size of this measure will be only 75% of a normal measure.

class reamber.o2jam.O2JEventPackage.O2JEventPackage(measure: int = 0, channel: int = -1, events: List[Union[reamber.o2jam.O2JBpmObj.O2JBpmObj, reamber.o2jam.O2JHitObj.O2JHitObj, reamber.o2jam.O2JHoldObj.O2JHoldObj, reamber.o2jam.O2JEventPackage.O2JEventMeasureChange]] = <factory>)¶

This class facilitates loading of Event Packages.

static readEventPackages(data: bytes, lvlPkgCounts: List[int]) → List[List[reamber.o2jam.O2JEventPackage.O2JEventPackage]]¶

Reads all events, this data found after the metadata (300:)

Parameters

  • lvlPkgCounts – The count of pkgs per level

  • data – All the event data in bytes.

static readEventsBpm(eventsData: bytes, currMeasure: float) → List[reamber.o2jam.O2JBpmObj.O2JBpmObj]¶

Reads the event’s bpms.

Just like the Notes, this can have disabled points where Bpm == 0, that means there’s no bpm there.

This is under the presumption that Bpm == 0 is not supported at all.

Parameters

  • eventsData – The bytes to unpack.

  • currMeasure – The current measure, used to calculate the offset later.

Returns

Returns a List of Bpm Points found.

static readEventsMeasure(eventsData: bytes) → float¶

Reads the fractional measure data.

This may not work as intended as there is no ojn files to test this feature.

Parameters

eventsData – The 4 byte data point to unpack.

Returns

Returns a float indicating the fraction of the measure.

static readEventsNote(eventsData: bytes, column: int, holdBuffer: Dict[int, reamber.o2jam.O2JHoldObj.O2JHoldObj], currMeasure: float) → List[Union[reamber.o2jam.O2JHitObj.O2JHitObj, reamber.o2jam.O2JHoldObj.O2JHoldObj]]¶

Reads the event’s notes.

This can have disabled points dictated by the first 2 bytes (see: ‘enabled’)

Parameters

  • eventsData – The bytes to unpack.

  • column – The current column, this can be found in the header.

  • holdBuffer – The hold buffer, this acts like a static variable to facilitate head and tail matching.

  • currMeasure – The current measure, used to calculate the offset later.

Returns

Returns a List of Bpm Points found.
